content: agreed, we should :) how does everyone's schedule look like for the following weeks ?
I could do Oct 8 or Oct 15, actually, probably any Friday in October apart from this one
oct 8 next week is a bit tough for me, I could the 15th and all the other fridays as well
(and it'll give me a bit of time to actually generate some facts :sweat: )
For me, both dates are fine as of now
@lqd I have some extra vacation time this week, some of which I could use on .next. I was going to ask anyways, as I don't wanna step on your feet - is there something I could do to help you out?

thanks a bunch for the offer ! it's a bit hard for me to tell how to divvy this up tbh. I'm sure familiarity with the variant and fact generation, and having some understanding of it among us all is a good thing. So, working on .next in whatever way you see fit, will be helpful. Don't worry about stepping on my feet, it's work I need to do to familiarize myself more with the process anyways, regardless of any PRs we end up making.

and in the grand scheme of things, less important work than hooking it up to rustc by implementing fact generation there (it's of course a stepping stone that helps understand how to do that though) and using dylan's souffl√© work -- which will be key to validate/invalidate the idea
Yeah, I also see it as hard to parallelize, which is why I asked. Some of the test-related tasks would be nice to do with the new system, but I'll look through those again during the week.
